IR-ID-01.description: Determine the extent of the incident, affected users, systems, and time range.
IR-ID-01.implementation_guidance: Review reported email content, headers, timestamps, affected accounts, and any related alerts or logs to understand how far the incident may have spread.
IR-ID-01.risk_if_skipped: Underestimating scope may result in incomplete containment and continued compromise.

IR-ID-02.description: Preserve relevant evidence for investigation and potential escalation.
IR-ID-02.implementation_guidance: Secure copies of emails, logs, and affected system data. Avoid modifying original artifacts until evidence is preserved.
IR-ID-02.risk_if_skipped: Loss of evidence may prevent root cause analysis or compliance investigations.

IR-ID-03.description: Analyze malware characteristics to determine family, capabilities, and indicators of compromise.
IR-ID-03.implementation_guidance: Submit suspicious files to sandbox analysis, check hash values against threat intelligence databases, and document behavioral indicators.
IR-ID-03.risk_if_skipped: Unknown malware capabilities may lead to ineffective containment strategies.

IR-CON-01.description: Prevent further spread or misuse by isolating impacted assets.
IR-CON-01.implementation_guidance: Temporarily disable affected user accounts or isolate systems from the network without powering them off.
IR-CON-01.risk_if_skipped: Attackers may continue lateral movement or data access.

IR-CON-02.description: Immediately stop unauthorized access using exposed credentials.
IR-CON-02.implementation_guidance: Disable the account, reset credentials, invalidate active sessions, and enforce reauthentication.
IR-CON-02.risk_if_skipped: Compromised credentials may continue to be abused.

IR-CON-03.description: Inform the affected user about the incident and required actions.
IR-CON-03.implementation_guidance: Advise the user not to interact further with the suspicious content and to report any additional anomalies.
IR-CON-03.risk_if_skipped: User may unknowingly worsen the incident or repeat unsafe behavior.

IR-CON-04.description: Restrict lateral movement by implementing emergency network access controls.
IR-CON-04.implementation_guidance: Configure firewall rules to limit communication between affected and critical systems. Block unnecessary protocols and restrict privileged account usage.
IR-CON-04.risk_if_skipped: Malware or attackers may spread to additional systems and escalate privileges.

IR-CON-05.description: Prevent communication with command and control servers or malicious domains.
IR-CON-05.implementation_guidance: Update firewall, DNS, and proxy rules to block identified malicious IP addresses, domains, and URLs associated with the incident.
IR-CON-05.risk_if_skipped: Malware may continue receiving commands or exfiltrating data to attacker infrastructure.

IR-CON-06.description: Temporarily disable services being exploited to prevent further compromise.
IR-CON-06.implementation_guidance: Identify and disable vulnerable network services, protocols, or applications being leveraged for attack propagation or persistence.
IR-CON-06.risk_if_skipped: Attack vectors remain available for continued exploitation and system compromise.

IR-ERAD-01.description: Eliminate malicious content or access paths from the environment.
IR-ERAD-01.implementation_guidance: Delete phishing emails from mailboxes, remove malware files and executables, revoke malicious links, and remove unauthorized access tokens or scheduled tasks.
IR-ERAD-01.risk_if_skipped: Residual artifacts may re-trigger compromise or maintain attacker access.

IR-ERAD-02.description: Ensure previously exposed credentials can no longer be used.
IR-ERAD-02.implementation_guidance: Force password resets for affected accounts, rotate API keys and service account credentials, review and revoke privileged access assignments.
IR-ERAD-02.risk_if_skipped: Attackers may regain access using unchanged or compromised credentials.

IR-ERAD-03.description: Apply security patches to close exploited vulnerabilities.
IR-ERAD-03.implementation_guidance: Identify exploited vulnerabilities through forensic analysis and apply relevant patches or configuration changes to prevent re-exploitation.
IR-ERAD-03.risk_if_skipped: Same vulnerabilities can be exploited again leading to reinfection or compromise.

IR-ERAD-04.description: Eliminate malware persistence techniques to prevent reinfection.
IR-ERAD-04.implementation_guidance: Remove registry modifications, malicious scheduled tasks, startup entries, service installations, and unauthorized user accounts created by malware.
IR-ERAD-04.risk_if_skipped: Malware may automatically restart or reinstall after system reboots.

IR-REC-01.description: Confirm that affected systems and accounts are operating securely.
IR-REC-01.implementation_guidance: Monitor logs, validate authentication behavior, scan for malware, verify system configurations, and ensure no unauthorized changes persist.
IR-REC-01.risk_if_skipped: Undetected persistence mechanisms or backdoors may remain active.

IR-REC-02.description: Safely return systems and users to normal operational status.
IR-REC-02.implementation_guidance: Re-enable accounts or systems after validation, restore services in controlled manner, and ensure users can resume work securely with proper monitoring.
IR-REC-02.risk_if_skipped: Prolonged disruption impacts business operations or insecure restoration may occur.

IR-REC-03.description: Recover data and systems from verified clean backup copies.
IR-REC-03.implementation_guidance: Identify backup versions predating the incident, verify backup integrity, test restoration in isolated environment, then restore to production after validation.
IR-REC-03.risk_if_skipped: Data loss may be permanent or restored systems may contain malware if backups are compromised.

IR-REC-04.description: Deploy additional monitoring to detect potential reinfection or related activity.
IR-REC-04.implementation_guidance: Enable enhanced logging on recovered systems, implement specific detection rules for observed attack patterns, increase monitoring frequency for affected assets.
IR-REC-04.risk_if_skipped: Reinfection attempts or residual threats may go undetected.

IR-POST-01.description: Analyze the incident, response effectiveness, and identify lessons learned.
IR-POST-01.implementation_guidance: Document complete incident timeline, assess response gaps and effectiveness, identify improvement opportunities, and update incident response procedures based on lessons learned.
IR-POST-01.risk_if_skipped: Recurring incidents may occur due to unresolved weaknesses and response inefficiencies.

IR-POST-02.description: Reduce likelihood of similar incidents in the future.
IR-POST-02.implementation_guidance: Update training materials with real incident examples, refine email filtering and detection rules, improve authentication controls, and implement additional preventive measures based on incident analysis.
IR-POST-02.risk_if_skipped: Same attack patterns and techniques may succeed again against unprepared users and systems.

IR-POST-03.description: Share and integrate indicators of compromise to improve organizational defenses.
IR-POST-03.implementation_guidance: Document attack indicators, update threat intelligence platforms with IOCs, share anonymized incident details with industry peers and ISACs, configure detection systems with new signatures.
IR-POST-03.risk_if_skipped: Organization and community miss opportunities to detect and prevent similar attacks.

IR-POST-04.description: Fulfill legal and regulatory notification requirements.
IR-POST-04.implementation_guidance: Determine reporting obligations based on incident type and data involved, notify affected parties and regulators within required timeframes, document all compliance actions taken.
IR-POST-04.risk_if_skipped: Regulatory penalties, legal liability, and compliance violations may result from missed reporting requirements.
